alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 16 at 1:36PM MDT until April 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR WESTERN AND CENTRAL NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM SUNDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong winds, very dry conditions, above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass will persist across western and central NM through this evening. Critical fire weather conditions will return to parts of the central and northeast highlands Sunday with strong west to northwest winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM MDT SUNDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 7 PM MDT Sunday. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands through 8 pm this evening and from 10 am to 7 pm Sunday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 with gusts to 40 mph today. West to northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 10%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
